task_summary: Pick up the brown object from the tabletop and lift it securely.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator must pick up a small brown object from a cluttered tabletop containing colored bottles/cylinders. The robot first perceives the scene, verifies the brown target, prepares by opening the gripper, approaches and aligns for a precise grasp, executes a side grasp, confirms the object is secured, and lifts it a short distance to complete the pickup. No placement is required. Movements should be careful yet efficient to avoid disturbing nearby items.
preconditions: Robot is homed and within workspace reach of the table.
Camera feed available to detect the brown object.
stepwise_plan: Open the gripper to the target width.
Approach and align to grasp pose with tight tolerance.
Raise the held object slightly above the table.
success_criteria: Object lifted at least 0.10 m above table.
failure_and_recovery: If alignment fails, re-approach with the same tolerance.
If grasp fails, reopen gripper and retry pick.
If slip detected, re-attempt pick after retreating slightly.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the object is detected in the gripper and lifted the target distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Perceive the brown object using vision; retry guarded.
Verify the target remains visible before approaching.
Move the TCP to align with the target using tight tolerance.
Execute a standard side grasp and close gripper.
Check that the object is secured.
Lift the grasped object above the table.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to occlusion or lighting.
Collision with neighboring items during approach.
recovery_strategy: Re-open gripper and re-approach with same tolerance.
If slip, lower, reopen, and re-pick.
assumptions: The 'brown object' refers to the tan/orange item on the right side of the table in multiple frames.
No placement goal is specified; lifting suffices for success.
Contact-sheet blur may hide brief gripper closure; annotations reflect most probable phases.
